intro: Cephalorrhynchus polycladus, commonly known as the hairy antler plant, is a unique species within the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, branched stems that resemble antlers, hence its common name. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its leaves are pinnately lobed and covered in fine hairs, contributing to its textured appearance. This plant is typically found in moist, shaded environments and is valued for its ornamental qualities.
